subject: Proximus to Negotiate New HQ Building with Nextensa
overview: Proximus has entered into exclusive negotiations with Nextensa for the sale of its current headquarters in Brussels and the potential development of a new office at the Tour & Taxis site. This move comes after a previous deal with Immobel fell through. Proximus aims to reduce its office space due to increased remote work and will use the sale proceeds to fund its fiber rollout. The company anticipates moving to the new location in the first half of 2027, with the new offices ready by the first half of 2029. An agreement is expected in Q2 of 2025.

subject: Proximus Extends Maturity of EUR 700 Million Revolving Credit Facility
overview: Proximus has successfully refinanced its EUR 700 million revolving credit facility with a group of Belgian and international banks. The renewed facility has a 5-year term with two 1-year extension options and will serve as a liquidity reserve. The credit margin is linked to the achievement of ESG targets, which will be agreed by the end of 2025.

subject: Scarlet Offers More Data at Same Price
overview: Scarlet, a subsidiary of Proximus, has increased the data volumes on its mobile plans without raising prices, starting in 2025.

subject: Proximus and Sagemcom Test Cargo Sailboat in Supply Chain
overview: Proximus and Sagemcom are testing the use of a cargo sailboat in their supply chain, demonstrating a commitment to sustainable practices.

subject: Proximus Creates Proximus Global
overview: Proximus has created Proximus Global, an entity that consolidates its international activities, including BICS, Telesign, and Route Mobile. This new unit is valued at approximately €3.1 billion.

subject: Proximus Fiber Network Receives Recognition
overview: Proximus' fiber network has been recognized for its speed and performance by nPerf and Ookla®, two international institutions specializing in network quality measurement.
